unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about the best way to write addresses for hotel bookings in India, especially when you're coming from abroad, right? It's a bit different than just putting it on a letter.
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about the best way to write addresses for hotel bookings in India, especially when you're coming from abroad, right? It's a bit different than just putting it on a letter.

unnormalised: First, always, ALWAYS include the PIN code. Seriously. No matter how well you write the rest of the address, if the PIN code's wrong, it's going to the wrong place. Think of it like the ZIP code in the US, but even more crucial. Indian postal system relies heavily on it. It is a 6 digit number. Like 110001 (New Delhi) or 400001 (Mumbai).
normalised: First, always, ALWAYS include the P-I-N code. Seriously. No matter how well you write the rest of the address, if the P-I-N code's wrong, it's going to the wrong place. Think of it like the Z-I-P code in the U-S, but even more crucial. Indian postal system relies heavily on it. It is a six digit number. Like one one zero zero zero one (New Delhi) or four zero zero zero zero one (Mumbai).

unnormalised: Next, be as specific as possible. "Near the market" isn't helpful. "Opposite CCD, Linking Road" is way better. Especially in crowded cities like Mumbai or Kolkata, landmarks help a ton. If the hotel is inside a complex, mention that. E.g., "Hotel XYZ, inside ABC Complex, 123 Main Road". Include flat number as well. For example: Flat No 201, Building A, XYZ Apartments.
normalised: Next, be as specific as possible. "Near the market" isn't helpful. "Opposite C-C-D, Linking Road" is way better. Especially in crowded cities like Mumbai or Kolkata, landmarks help a ton. If the hotel is inside a complex, mention that. E.g., "Hotel X-Y-Z, inside A-B-C Complex, one two three Main Road". Include flat number as well. For example: Flat Number two zero one, Building A, X-Y-Z Apartments.

unnormalised: Don't assume the local delivery guys know the area even if you do! I made this mistake once while ordering food to 12, Park Street, and the delivery guy kept calling me saying that the area is very big and he doesn't know exactly where I am.
normalised: Don't assume the local delivery guys know the area even if you do! I made this mistake once while ordering food to twelve, Park Street, and the delivery guy kept calling me saying that the area is very big and he doesn't know exactly where I am.

unnormalised: For hotels within larger hotels like guest houses, mention the guest house or building name FIRST. It is the most important. So, like "XYZ Guest House, Inside Hotel ABC, MG Road". Most delivery guys will give up looking inside hotel ABC.
normalised: For hotels within larger hotels like guest houses, mention the guest house or building name FIRST. It is the most important. So, like "X-Y-Z Guest House, Inside Hotel A-B-C, M-G Road". Most delivery guys will give up looking inside hotel A-B-C.

unnormalised: Okay, here’s a sample address you can adapt:
normalised: Okay, here’s a sample address you can adapt:

unnormalised: Hotel Sunshine, 45-B, Linking Road, Near Bandra Talao, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400050, India. (Attn: Rakesh Kumar, Reservation Confirmation No. 7890123). Always put "Attn:" followed by your name and reservation number.
normalised: Hotel Sunshine, four five dash B, Linking Road, Near Bandra Talao, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra four zero zero zero five zero, India. (Attn: Rakesh Kumar, Reservation Confirmation Number seven eight nine zero one two three). Always put "Attn:" followed by your name and reservation number.

unnormalised: Oh and last thing, use a local contact number. If there's a problem, they can call an Indian number faster than an international one. You can use the hotel's number itself. That should be available with the hotel. Or use your friend's number.
normalised: Oh and last thing, use a local contact number. If there's a problem, they can call an Indian number faster than an international one. You can use the hotel's number itself. That should be available with the hotel. Or use your friend's number.

unnormalised: Finally, double, triple check everything before submitting it with your booking. Wrong addresses can lead to delays. It's always better to pre-pone any such mistakes that can be avoided with little effort.
normalised: Finally, double, triple check everything before submitting it with your booking. Wrong addresses can lead to delays. It's always better to pre-pone any such mistakes that can be avoided with little effort.
